message.content:
cs.CL, cs.AI, cs.LG, cs.NE, cs.SD 

This paper is about developing a neural framework for generating unstructured persona-oriented dialogues. The paper focuses on natural language processing and machine learning techniques, which are typically covered in the Computer Science sub-categories of cs.CL (Computation and Language) and cs.AI (Artificial Intelligence). The paper also proposes a variational auto-encoder (VAE) based topic model, which falls under the sub-category of cs.LG (Machine Learning). Additionally, the paper introduces two persona-oriented loss functions, which are related to optimization and training of neural networks, and thus could be classified under cs.NE (Neural and Evolutionary Computing). Finally, the paper deals with dialogue generation, which could be considered as a sub-topic of cs.SD (Sound).
